France's situation causes concern in Brussels
subhead: The country's political instability, the rise of the far right and deteriorating public finances are worrying its European partners. The appointment of PM Sébastien Lecornu, who has so far not been very involved in EU affairs, has done little to reassure them.

French and American far right gather in Paris for Charlie Kirk commemoration
subhead: On Friday, nearly 250 people gathered in Paris to honor the memory of the pro-Trump activist who was killed on September 10. As with the vigils held in the US, the gathering in Paris combined political and religious rhetoric.

title: UN High Seas Treaty, ratified by 60 countries, to take effect in early 2026
subhead: The High Seas Treaty, which aims to 'preserve the marine environment,' has been the subject of two decades of negotiations. Its implementation presents numerous challenges.

title: On the 250th anniversary of Jane Austen's birth, take a trip into the world of the English novelist's superfans
subhead: They are known as 'Janeites,' these ardent admirers of the author of 'Sense and Sensibility' and 'Pride and Prejudice' who gather in period costume for dinners, balls and conferences dedicated to their idol. Many of them have made their way to Bath for the 10-day Jane Austen Festival in September, which this year celebrates the 250th anniversary of the novelist's birth.

title: Two French baby boomers on what their generation got wrong
subhead: The economist Jean Pisani-Ferry and the politician Jean-Louis Bourlanges each delivered a harsh review of the past decades as they were decorated with the Légion d'Honneur in early September.

Macron and PM Lecornu keep low profiles amid social unrest
subhead: The silence from the top of the French state, as two waves of social protest erupted in eight days, gave opposition parties and labor unions free rein to challenge the prime minister and influence the agenda of his future government.

title: French protestors caught between anger and disillusionment
subhead: Eight days after the 'Block Everything' protest movement on September 10, the union coalition called for mobilization against 'austerity' on Thursday, September 18. More than 250 gatherings took place across France, demanding a change in political direction and greater tax justice.

title: Eleven places in France to visit during 2025 European Heritage Days
subhead: Each fall, the event opens doors to historic sites that are usually closed to the public. Le Monde picks 11 of the most compelling hidden gems in France.
